images.caption: Figure 1:Overview for the MITS approach. The search tree is incrementally constructed by generating reasoning steps conditioned on prior context. Dynamic sampling controls the number of candidates (i.e., nodes) generated at each step. Beam search is applied to prune less promising paths. Weighted average voting is used to aggregate candidates and select the final output.
Figure 2:Prompt examples for step-by-step reasoning generation, showing the iterative generation from initial step to subsequent steps, similar to(Lai etÂ al.,2024).

Figure 3:Performance comparison across different rollouts on the ARC-Challenge dataset. MITS not only demonstrates superior performance in early stages with fewer rollouts, but also continues to improve with increased computational budget.
